column4: I'm having issues with my laptop, it won't recognize when a cable is connected to the ethernet adapter
did you connect before booting in ?
I've done several reboots with the cable still connected
ifconfig in the terminal , then sudo dhclient eth0
didn't work. I believe it might be a hardware issue, since none of the leds on the ethernet port ever flashes
what about the network manager , what are your settings ..right click on it
right click where?
that only gives me a context menu with About, Remove from panel etc.
in the terminal, sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
I've tried that one before as well, didn't do anything different this time
ok  , alt+F2 , /etc/network/interfaces , what's listed there ?
http://pastebin.com/9zgvnrtm
try,  ifup eth0 in the terminal
sorry, it should be , sudo ifup eth0
yeah, figured
what the command said was that eth0 was already configured
it's rather odd , ethernet should work, right out if the box , check this file , make sure the enabled states are all  =true , kdesudo kate /var/lib/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.state
networking, wireless and WWAN is set to true in that file
can it see the gateway /router , route ,  in the terminal ....
no, only on the wireless interface can see the router, not eth0
do you use a modeswitch on your internet connection ?
